info.title: Retailer to Woop
info.description: This document contains the technical information about Woop APIs for carriers. For any questions or clarification, please contact the internal technical team. To use "Retailer to Woop" APIs, you must use the confidential access codes provided when you created your retailer account on the platform. [See documentation](https://woop.stoplight.io/docs/retailer/docs/Basis/2.Authentication.md) The version currently available in the documentation is Version 1.7.0

get.description: Check whether the application is functioning

401.description: Unauthorized

put.description: Changes the package status in order to yield the package responsability to the carrier

containerId.description:
This item is required once you want to add a package state. 

You can fill in the trailerId and/or the palletId.

post.description: This method allows a Click&Collect collection request to be made at a specific collection location. The collection order will be created once the request is validated and the booking slot selected.

requestBody.description: Contains the creation information of the collection request.

204.description: Successful creation of the collection request

400.description: Missing and/or incorrect items in the body

value.message: child "location" fails because [child "addressLine1" fails because ["addressLine1" is required], child "id" fails because ["id" is required]]

401.description: You are not authorised to access this item

403.description:
Creation of a collection request is not possible

[See the list of reasons](https://woop.stoplight.io/docs/retailer/docs/Models/Error%20reasons.md)

value.message: Store doesn't exist or is inactive

409.description: A collection request with this reference already exists on the platform.

delete.description: This method allows you to cancel the reservation of a time slot for a delivery request at a specific carrier and location.

requestBody.description: Contains the modification information of a collection request.

204.description: Successful modification of the collection request

delete.description:
This method allows you to cancel a collection request initially created by the retailer.

The method removes the time slot reservation as well as the collection request from the store.

204.description: Collection request successfully processed, collection request cancelled

401.description: You are not authorised to access this item

403.description: The collection request cannot be cancelled

firstAvailableSlot.description: date of the first available slot

comment.description: If necessary, an optional comment can be added when cancelling

202.description: The cancellation has been processed, but may result in additional costs

401.description: You are not authorised to access this item

403.description: The order cannot be cancelled

409.description: The order is already cancelled or an action is already in progress on this order

get.description: This method returns the order details.

400.description: You are not authorised to access this item

patch.description: This method allows you to modify an order. The update may trigger a cancellation of the order + creation of a new order if the modified information is considered important and directly impacts the delivery.

Updating the order is not possible

202.description: the order retry has been registered

post.description:
The aim of this method is to perform a retry if an order has a functional error status (ORDER_WITH_NO_CARRIER_ELIGIBLE, ORDER_WITH_NO_QUOTE, ORDER_WITH_NO_CARRIER_AVAILABLE, ORDER_REFUSED_DELIVERY).
This API will use exactly the same data sent for the POST /orders initial call (if part of the order data has change, then the PATCH /orders/{orderId} API has to be called instead).

This method allows you to create an order from Woop.
Once the order has been validated, quotes will be sent to the carriers. The delivery order will then be created once a quote has been validated.

202.description: Date in some fields are incorrect

message.example: Picking start MUST be before delivery start

translationKey.description: technical error message for Woop Team

errors.message: Picking start MUST be before delivery start

get.description:
This method returns the details of one or more orders according to the selected filters.

The method used is governed by the following constraints:

- Result limited to 100 orders
- Sorting orders from oldest to most recent

Note: It is recommended to regularly clean old test orders on staging environment.

parameters.name: deliverySubStatus
parameters.description: Filters the list of commands based on the subStatus

parameters.name: fromPickingDate
parameters.description: Filter by picking date. Allows you to retrieve orders from this date.

parameters.name: toPickingDate
parameters.description: Filter by picking date. Allows you to retrieve orders prior to this date.

This method retrieves a carrier label based on the order identifier. 
The label can be retrieved in several formats (provided the carrier is compatible with that format).

parameters.name: size

base64.description: The label is returned in base64 in the format indicated at the time of the call

post.description:
This method retrieves the list of relay-point for all the carriers associed to your account.

The method works like a search engine based on just two mandatory criteria: Latitude and Longitude of the delivery point. 

Search options enable you to refine the method's eligibility engine. The more options there are, the more precise the results will be. 

Optionally, you can search for a relay-point based on the contents of the customer basket (parcel dimensions: length, width, height and weight). This allows you to suggest delivery points capable of receiving parcels of a certain weight. 

[See explanation](https://woop.stoplight.io/docs/retailer/docs/Models/Pickup%20points.md)

requestBody.description: Contains the information for a relay point search.

200.description: OK. Contains the retrieved relay points.

400.description: Missing and/or incorrect items in the body

401.description: You are not allowed to access this item.

403.description: Request for 'storeId' not possible

post.description:
This method returns the available carriers and delivery services for an order. The method returns all available services and carriers according to the starting point of the order, (optional) destination and content of the shopping cart. 

Eligibility is calculated according to certain delivery constraints defined by the carrier. [See explanation](https://woop.stoplight.io/docs/retailer/docs/Models/Carrier%20eligibility%20constraint.md)

200.description: OK. Contains the document in its original format

401.description: You are not authorised to access this item

403.description: You cannot access this resource

parameters.description: To return a json containing base64, set the value to "application/json"

get.description:
This method allows you to retrieve a carrier label from a sales order for a particular package. The label can be retrieved in several formats (provided the carrier is compatible with that format).

The retrieved label is unique and is associated with a single package in the order.

put.description: This method allows the retailer to send an update on the collection status. The retailer must enter the next collection tracking status to progress the collection request. This delivery tracking status must be consistent with the defined workflow. Workflow and status list

In all cases, tag is transmitted to carrier.

optIn.title: Opt-in (optIn)
optIn.description:
Defines the explicit consent of the customer to be contacted for survey or delivery tracking events for a specific channel.
If a channel is not present, notifications won't be sent on this channel

To ensure backward compatibility, if the optin section is not sent, then the customer's implicit consent will be considered and notifications sent.

survey.description: For all notifications related to satisfaction survey.

delivery.description: For all notifications related to delivery tracking.

channel.description: Refers to the channel use to communicate.
